intro: Phacelia depauperata, commonly known as the poorflower phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its small, delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as roadsides and gravelly soils. It has hairy stems and leaves that are often glandular, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Phacelia depauperata is known for its short flowering period, usually in the spring or early summer.
